intro: Bidens cabopulmensis, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open areas and has hairy, narrow leaves. Its flowers are yellow with dark centers and bloom from summer to fall. Bidens cabopulmensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
